heading1: Accessibility statement for national infrastructure projects
paragraph1: This accessibility statement applies to the
paragraph2: This website is run by the Planning Inspectorate. We want as many people as possible to be able to use this website. For example, that means you should be able to:
listItem1: change colours, contrast levels and fonts
listItem2: zoom in up to 300% without the text spilling off the screen
listItem3: navigate most of the website using just a keyboard
listItem4: navigate most of the website using speech recognition software
listItem5: listen to most of the website using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)
paragraph3: We've also made the text as simple as possible to understand.
paragraph4: {{-link}} has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.
paragraph5: This service is partially compliant with the {{-link}} AA standard.
paragraph6: We know some parts of this website are not fully accessible:
listItem6: some pages and document attachments are not written in plain English
listItem7: many documents are in PDF format and are not accessible
listItem8: there may be some links which do not provide enough context
listItem9: people using assistive technology may find some parts of the site difficult to navigate
paragraph7: The compliance status section below gives more detail on the areas of the site that are not fully accessible.
paragraph8: If you need information on this website in a different format like accessible PDF, large print, easy read, audio recording or braille:
paragraph9: We'll consider your request and get back to you in 10 working days.
heading5: Reporting accessibility problems with this service
paragraph10: We're always looking to improve the accessibility of this website.
paragraph11: If you contact us with a complaint and you're not happy with our response {{-link}}.
paragraph11LinkText: contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS)
paragraph12: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the ‘accessibility regulations').
heading7: Technical information about this website's accessibility
paragraph13: The Planning Inspectorate is committed to making its websites accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.
paragraph14: This website is partially compliant with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines version 2.2 AA standard due to the non-compliances listed below.
paragraph15: The content listed below is non-accessible for the following reasons.
listItem12: When navigating a page with speech recognition software, such as Dragon Naturally Speaking, users may not be able to expand elements within a page to reveal additional information. This does not comply with WCAG 2.2 success criteria 4.1.2 (Name, Role, Value). MouseGrid, a feature in the Windows Speech Recognition app, can be used as an alternative.
listItem13: Uploading files with Dragon Naturally Speaking software fails. This does not comply with WCAG 2.2 success criteria 4.1.2 (Name, Role, Value). Dragon users may still be able to upload files using voice commands if the associated input element is given “role=link” and a tabindex of 0. Voice commands such as “click link” or saying the linked label should then open the file select menu.
paragraph16: Some of our PDFs and Word documents are essential to providing our services. For example, we have PDFs with information on how users can access our services, and forms published as Word documents. Many of these documents are not accessible to a screen reader. This does not comply with WCAG 2.2 success criterion 4.1.2 (Name, Role, Value). This includes documents containing:
listItem15: incorrect or missing tags, this does not comply with WCAG 2.2 success criterion 1.3.2 (Meaningful Sequence)
listItem16: diagrams without a text alternative, this does not comply with WCAG 2.2 success criteria 1.1.1 (Non-text Content)
paragraph17: View the {{-link}} of the organisation that published the document to report any problems or request documents in an alternative format. If more than one organisation is listed, view the accessible document policy of the first.
paragraph18: Where possible, we try to fix these as soon as we can.
heading12: Content that's not within the scope of the accessibility regulations
paragraph19: The accessibility regulations do not require us to fix PDFs or other documents published before 23 September 2018 if they're not essential to providing our services.
paragraph20: Any new PDFs or Word documents we publish will meet accessibility standards.
paragraph21: This accessibility statement was first prepared on 5 February 2025.
paragraph22: An accessibility report of the service by Zoonou took place in October 2023 against the WCAG 2.2 AA standard. It included extensive automated and manual testing on a range of browsers and assistive technologies.
paragraph23: This statement was last reviewed on 14 May 2025.
heading15: What we’re doing to improve accessibility
paragraph26: We are committed to working on the issues listed as non-compliant and we will update this accessibility statement when these issues are fixed. Whenever we release new features, we ensure they meet WCAG 2.2 AA standard.
paragraph27: If you find any problems not listed on this page or think we're not meeting accessibility requirements.
